Reviews.Title: “Easter Vacation”
Reviews.Author: miguel b
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed over Easter with my girlfriend in your Hotel and wanted to thank the staff from reception to housekeeping for a superb pleasant stay. It made our trip much easier with the commodities from bar to restaurant, (although in this section much needed support might be better) but overall the staff reacted in a very professional way. We look forward to stay in your Hotel in a very near future,,,thanks again for a nice experience!! best regards Mr. Barletta/Miss Dahl.

Reviews.Title: “free private garage-excellent reception staff”
Reviews.Author: HouseStarkWinterfell
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for both business and leisure. i checked in late but yet i found two very nice and caring guys at the reception desk who promptly told me to park my car in the garage, like they knew it was a rented car i had :) The room was reasonably spacious and comfortable and i chose to not to have breakfast in the morning since i was leaving early. Free Wi-fi in the lobby, in the room it's chargeable but it's one more reason to spend some time in the beautiful hotel lobby. All the reception staff had an impressive command of english (rare in italy) and has given me many useful tips during my 4 nights stay. If you have a car, Rome city centre's only 15 minutes drive and it's pretty straight forward to get there.. i will surely be back .

Reviews.Title: “Quite far from Rome's Fiumicino airport”
Reviews.Author: akide
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire and chose the area close to Rome's Fiomicino's Airport. Please beware that this hotel is quite far from the airport AND quite far from Rome. The easiest way to get to this hotel is to take a taxi from the airport. The hotel doesn't offer a shuttle bus, you can negotiate a fare from the Airport to the hotel. We were a group of 6, and negotiated 10 Euros a person for the ride from the airport to the hotel. The area around the hotel is quite deserted, a block and a half away there's a small plaza where there's a conveinence store, pizza shop, slot machines and a small restaurant. A 25 minute walk and there's a supermarket. This supermarket is quite a long walk, but it is quite a big supermarket that has everything you need. Checking in to the hotel was a quick process, not all the check-in agents know English, so just be patient and they'll be able to help you. There's complimentary wifi in the lobby and public areas. There's wifi and hardwired Internet available in the rooms for a fee. The fitness centre, and gym is open until 9pm. It was strange however we got to the fitness centre at around 8:30pm, and the attendent said that there's a 5 EURO charge to use the sauna. I'm not sure if this is correct or if he just wanted to discourage me to use the sauna because there was 30 minutes left until the fitness centre is closed. I should have mentioned this during my check-out, but I was in a rush to catch my flight and didn't have time to complain about the sauna. The room that I was in was very modern, and they also included a free bottle of sparkling water in the fridge in my room. Plenty of channels available on tv, and the washroom was clean, quite modern and acceptable. If I had a choice, I wouldn't stay at this hotel due to its location, it is very far from the airport, and very far from the city. To get from central Rome to the hotel you have to take the subway, then transfer to a different line and take a bus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfumed rooms”
Reviews.Author: evor50
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from Tuesday noon to Friday noon for a work conference, with everything paid for, so I can't comment on price/value. The participants came from all over Europe, so this hotel was chosen because it's relatively close to the airport. It's however an ordeal to get into the historic city of Rome. First you have to get a bus to reach a metro station, then it's a switch to the subway. They are not really coordinated, so there could be a 15-20 minute wait between metro/bus, depending on time and day of the week. Taxi is available, but not cheap. The food for us was fine, a buffet where one could choose from various hot and cold dishes plus a dessert. One of the nights we tried to get a drink in the bar on the lobby, but there was no one around to be found to serve us, so we skipped that idea. My room actually was two rooms, first was a 'sitting room' with a minibar and a sofa - I never used it. The bedroom and bathroom were clean, but I had problems with the heavy smell of perfume that was absolutely overwhelming! My first reaction when I first entered the room was to open the windows wide, to have some fresh air in! I complained to the reception, and also left a note (in Italian) to the maid, and I don't think they put more perfume in, but the smell lingered... I pointed out to them that it could be dangerous for people with asthma or other respiratory problems, or allergies. I don't understand why they didn't think of that themselves! In my room I had a free wifi internet connection, which I understand is not standard, but it was often very slow. To get a comfortable speed you had to choose a time of day when not so many people were using it.

Reviews.Title: “Do not look after Their customers”
Reviews.Author: gordon164
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday Oct.2 and booked the shuttle service to downtown Rome for Monday morning. We were dropped off at the Colosium and I made a point to show the driver the schedule and pointed to the 7:30pm pick up time and repeteted the time in english. We arrived back at the pick up location(same as drop off) at 7:15pm and waited until 7:50pm. My wife and I were the only ones being picked up.We were down to our last 5 euros. We took a taxi back to the hotel. They would not pay the taxi. At first the girl at the front said we had cancelled the shuttle pick up. Then the night supervisor said we were not at the pick up location when the driver arrived at 7:30. The girl phoned the driver and he said he was there at 7:30 but we were not.They basically called us liers. WE HAD WORDS. After 15 minutes of arqueing they finally paid the taxi driver and charged my room. Also, the breakfast in the hotel is terrible. Rubber eggs and cold buffet.This was not our first time in Rome and we are familiar with the downtown area.Weare also seniors in our late 60's.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: ho_sik
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nts. Did not use any of the facilities, so cannot comment. But the reception staff were fine with us. The room was of a good size and clean, with kettle and fridge. Room rate was reasonable- choose to stay here because we had a car to go into Roma to see the sights. If you don't have a car I would not stayhere, it is so far out of town. Free wi fi in room. I know the Qatar crew stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MaiteQatar
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights with my husband. Rude staff, awful breakfast, and dirty bathroom...I don't think I need to add anything else!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gayathri_Iyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April 2011. I decided to stay here even though this hotel is NOT IN ROME because I had some points that I thought I’ll use. I also purchased some points to get the necessary figure for the 5 nights stay. First of all this is not a four star hotel and SPG should disassociate itself from this hotel as soon as it can! I knew we had made the wrong choice about a hotel in Rome when it took us 4 hours after baggage claim from Rome Fumicino airport to get to this hotel. We took the Buzshuttle for EUR 8 per person to Rome Termini. Walk into the Termini station which is about 5 mins from where the bus drops off. Cobble stone streets and dragging luggage, this was not fun! Then find a newspaper stand and buy the ticket, then look for the blue line and take one to EUR Fermi. This by itself is a village outside Rome. The hotel website says that you can take bus 705 from right outside EUR Fermi. It may sound easy but it’s not. None of the outer stations have escalators, so with luggage climbing up 2-3 flights of stairs from the metro out to the street is again NOT FUN! Then after waiting for 15 mins we realised that 705 comes at the other side of EUR Fermi; so we crossed the road only to find out that there’s another set of stairs that go down (not up) to another bus stand. Again, no escalators. Then we had to tell the bus driver we needed to get to Four Points and he didn’t know where it was. As you can see, we were frustrated with the hotel even before getting there. The taxis will cost you EUR 70 (if they knew you are a tourist). Here are some of the reasons I will not recommend this hotel to anyone. I have gotten better service from a 2-star hotel: - Hotel is NOT IN ROME even thought their address says Rome. It takes you 1 hour and 15 mins to get to Termini station (which is the main station). Then you need to find your way via bus or metro. Not advisable if you are here for sight-seeing. - Do not depend on the bus and metro timings listed. Buses and trains come and go in their own time. Bus 705 and 130 (Sundays only) take you to EUR Fermi and then you take line B to get to Termini. But this is unreliable if you are staying in Rome for sight-seeing. If you have a flight to catch, take a taxi or a private car, whatever the cost! You don’t want to miss your flight. - No one came forward to help us with luggage at check-in at the hotel - Air conditioning will NOT be turned on in April when it is 30 degrees C at night inside the room. My husband and I couldn’t sleep for 4 out of our 5 nights stay. One night we had to fight with the reception to ask for air con and they said they will be doing us a FAVOUR by turning it on only for the one night. - A/C vent unclean and sends out a foul smell when a/c is turned on by the technician from the outside. You cannot control the air con in your room. Now which four star hotel does that?! - Sheets were not changed even though I had placed the “change sheets” card on the bed. I had to call reception again and have housekeeping come back in again and change the sheets. - No bars or restaurants near the hotel. You would be better off eating your dinner in central Rome. But be aware that the Metro Line B runs only till 9:00 pm. So either eat early, or take-out food and get back to the hotel in time. - Breakfast was not included in our rate because of points. It’s 25 EUR per person. Apparently, the reception staff told us that it was a discounted rate. The original breakfast was EUR 50. I walked to the closest supermarket Carrefour (1 km away) and bought breakfast stuff for our 4 days in under EUR 25 (for BOTH of us!). - Uncomfortable bed. I had back and neck aches every morning - No coffee making machine inside the room. Room service charge is EUR 15 per tray! I haven’t even heard of this in 5-star hotels. - No free internet/wifi (except in the lobby). We used the free wifi in the lobby once. - Rude reception staff. Surprisingly the housekeeping staff seemed nicer. Like I said, the man at the reception actually told us that he will be doing us a “FAVOUR by turning on the air con” for the one night. It was the weirdest experience and I felt sorry for putting my husband through such crappy experience because I had used my points for the stay. Rome was the last leg of our 18 day vacation and we thought we had booked the best stay for our last part of the vacation but we were totally disappointed. My husband and I are both frequent travellers and have never had such experience even from a 2 star hotel much less an SPG! Now I notice that they've changed the name of the hotel from Four Points by Sheraton Roma West Hotel to Nicolaus Hotels Roma West. Does that mean SPG has removed this hotel from their properties? I hope so!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: connielimch
Reviews.Content: We had an unhappy and unpleasant experience during our stay in the hotel. On 12 June, 2011 my friend's handbag was stolen when our travel group of 16 were having breakfast at your hotel cafe in the private room on the ground floor, between 7.15am to 8.00am. We were very surprised it happened in such a well-reputed hotel and urge the hotel to strengthen its security.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: pupiczech
Reviews.Content: With the fairly dismal reviews I've seen on this hotel I wasn't expecting much. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel was beautiful, very contemporary, clean and well appointed. The rooms were larger than most and we were unexpectedly given a suite with a sitting room. The hotel was quite far from the city center but easy to get there via buses and the Metro. The neighborhood was a safe residential (mostly apts. and condos) area. We found a great little cafe a couple blocks away that was super cheap but really nice with good food. The only complaint I had was the bed.I believe they used the Italian marble they are so fond of for the beds and pillows. I'd definately stay there again but will bring my own pillow and maybe buy an egg crate topper for the bed at Ikea.

Reviews.Title: “sheraton on a budget”
Reviews.Author: andynaija
Reviews.Content: Front of hotel is appealing and lobby is beautiful. Check in was ok as receptionists are keen to handover your door card and get rid of you. I believe the people who complain most about this hotel are those who thought they have got a good hotel on a bargain price. This hotel is a SPG category 2 hotel therefore don't expect much and also look out for their discount price. The rooms are clean but common area carpets can do with a replacement. The room furniture are tired and wallpaper has not been changed for a while. The bathrooms are excellent and very clean. The location of the hotel is far from the city centre so if commuting by bus and metro add an extra 45mins to get to city centre or take the hotel bus for 5 euro return. The bus and metro cost 1 euro each way but if you want muliple use of metro buy the 4 euro per day ticket. Avoid bus 705 on Sundays and public holidays take bus 130. The meals are overpriced try a cafe beside the filling station next door to the hotel If you manage your expectations and need a decent hotel to explore Rome this is a place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in and I stay in hotels 120+ nights per year”
Reviews.Author: GrayauskieJ
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I ever stayed in. The hotel is dirty and the staff is rude. Buffet breakfast is always cold and they water down the coffee and juice instead of making/bringing more if they start to run out. Restaurant is also very dirty. You can't even buy a coffee in the morning - you have to buy the buffet breakfast. They have coffee vending machines that only take change, but the hotel has no change if you need it. If you do have change and put in more money than the product cost, the vending machines do not give change. They have a pool, but if you are a woman you need to wear a bathing cap and that will cost you 3 euros. Hotel staff is rude and must not like Americans because they would not wait on us in the restaurant, we waited 20 minutes while they served all the European customers that came in after us, and then we left. When we complained, they hotel staff did not care and just shrugged their shoulders at us. I could go on and on, but I'll just close with DO NOT STAY HERE - TERRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maripusha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean. Front desk staff is very helpful. The location is a bit far from the center, however you can take a bus just outside the hotel and it takes about 25 minutes to get to the metro station and about 15 more minutes to get to the center. Nice breakfast spread as well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but in the wrong part of town.”
Reviews.Author: Ramtrucker
Reviews.Content: Being an American, I expect a few things from hotels. #1 free internet, this hotel charges for it unless you use free wi-fi in the lobby. #2 somewhat of a comfy bed, this hotel completely fails in the comfy bed department. It was like plywood with a nice pillow. The double bed room is small, I would not recommend it for more than one person. The bathroom is nice however. Good shower, all tile walls and floor. Bidet that only sprays out, not up. The worst part of this hotel, is the area its in, kind of looks like the wrong part of town, not a place you would want to walk around at dark.

Reviews.Title: “dont get mis guided by the brand of Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: ATC11
Reviews.Content: enhanced breakfast was below std room carpets verry dirty rooms very far away from reception areas with luggage

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Enjoystour
Reviews.Content: We were a group of over 100 colleagues from India staying in Rome for 2-nights after a fabulous 2-days in Venice. To start with the check-in was absolutely chaotic with little help from reception, it was like a treasure hunting expedition to locate the room, carpeting on passage were centuries old and smelly. Each one of us faced unique issues like ACs not working, Electricity not there in room, no response from housekeeping even after repeated request, slow service from room service to name a few. The whole place is run down and needs urgent repair and renovation. The worst experience was the breakfast where for many vegetarians in the group even fruits were not there. Very limited spread on offer and extremely delayed replenishment.

Reviews.Title: “It was so...so...”
Reviews.Author: KatiaA7
Reviews.Content: The room was nice..clean...but the decoration its doesnt belong for a 4 stars hotel. The prices are good for Rome. The service was AWFULL!!! I arrived around 11am, i haved asked kindly the day before the reception if i can have my room earlier that the normal, they agree, but in the end i get it normaly at 3pm. I asked also when i arrived to the receptionist if he can keep my luggages till i get my room...she said yes...but im still waiting someone the take them!!! When i get the room (finally) i carried alone my lluggages...nobody helped me! and its a 4 stars hotel...supose to be! During the time i was waiting to get my room i sit on the cafe of the hotel...please note that the lobby and cafe was completly empty it was only me. The bartender come over and told me that if i want to use my laptop i cant seat there if i dont order something!!! The next day i asked the reception if i can seat in the same place like the day before and if it is allowed...and if i have to make an order to seat there and she was surprised of my strange question! Anyway in this hotel everyone of the staff create their own rules and decides whatever they thing its convinient! The room was Clean...the breakfast was perfect...The service Awfull!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amcsocal
Reviews.Content: My husband and family(there were 9 of us total) spent 7 nights at this hotel mid Sept 2010. As my husband and I are vacation owners of the Westin Kaanapali resort in Maui, we were able to get 3 rooms(based on SPG points). It's a level 2 hotel for SPG points which means I can get more rooms for less points. Since we are Starwood Preferred Guest gold members, they upgraded all the 3 rooms to a junior suite. The hotel isn't in the center of the city, but take the bus across the street in the back of the hotel(705 bus) takes you directly to the Eur Fermi subway station. Take the blue line and it takes you directly to the center of Rome(stops at the Coliseum, Circus Maximus, and Termini). You can transfer in Termini to the Red line to take you to Spagna(Spanish Steps) or there's a stop before Spagna for the Trevi Fountain. Costs 1 euro one way/ 2 euro round trip, cheap(you can buy metro tickets at any newspaper stand shops or little stores which are close to the hotel). It's cheaper to do this than the hop on/hop off tour in Rome, and saves you time as traffic in Rome is very busy. As I mentioned earlier, the hotel isn't in the center, but transportation is very convenient to take you to the center of Rome. If you stop in Termini, it's only a 5 min walk to the Grayline office, which you can get tours from there(ie Imperial Rome, Night tours, Vatican Museums, etc). The public bus/subways run from 5:30 am until midnight. Also, the hotel is located in a charming neighborhood. There's little shops and cafes around, and a bank within walking distance of the hotel. One of the restaurants we went, near the hotel treated us like family. After going there 3 times, they actually gave us complimentary home cooked meal on our last day. You get to experience more of local life than just the touristy part of Rome, which the suburb is definitely more quieter. There's also a couple of flea markets in the area, where it's cheaper to buy than in the touristy areas of Rome. The room rate from what I saw at the Four Points is definitely less than hotels in the center of Rome(I stayed at a hotel in the center close to the Roman Forum and ruins 8 years ago), and this hotel has larger rooms than a lot of the hotels in the center of the city(unless you're willing to pay big money for a larger room in the touristy area of the city). Great value, clean, larger rooms, and great access to public transportation for cheap to the center of the city, and if you don't mind actually exploring outside of the city. My family loved it as not only did we do the 'touristy' things, but we were able to see how the locals live. And everyone is very friendly, loved Rome and all of Italy!

Reviews.Title: “We used points, so value was great...”
Reviews.Author: huskerss2
Reviews.Content: We used points, so value was great. Hotel was very clean and we were upgraded to Jr. Suite. Only drawback was distance from city center, but bus/metro were so easy and only cost 2 eur round trip per person (one bus to Eur Fermi then hop on blue line to central termini and everything is available. But if you prefer, the hotel offers set shuttle service for a fee. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can get a good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kmalayWorld
Reviews.Content: Little far from city. They have shuttle at large interval but you need to pay 5 Euro one way to Rome. Public Bus behind the hotel and connects to metro station. If you can afford an hour to Rome it is ok to stay here. Few staff need to smile more. Should add some variety in Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Tarnwood
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days earlier this month. Although the address says "Rome", we found that it is considered too far out of the normal city circuit to be considered for a free pickup and had to pay taxis 52 Euro one day to go into the City for a bus tour (see my review on VasTours - don't use them) and nearly 55 Euro to be taken to the train station - both 20-25 minute rides by the way. There is a hotel shuttle into Rome which is convenient during certain hours of the day and we used that frequently as well. The Front Desk staff were polite and helpful, and the pool is wonderful. The restaurant was abysmal and there was no other place close by to get a meal. A vegetarian pizza was a piece of warmed flatbread with a little melted shredded cheese, a couple slices of grilled eggplant, raw tomatoes and cold french fries! The hotel may be economical, but in this case we certainly got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: chO56
Reviews.Content: we arrived april19. we were rerouted due to the volcanic ash fall. we were supposed to leave italy on april 17. we had to takes a rented-bus ride from 9am venice and arrived 7-8pm at the hotel we were tired. When my husband stood at the front desk and casually asked the male front desk personnel if there were room available. a very rude blond haired woman (i couldn't get her name) answered in a high shrilled irritated voice to ask your tour guide. My husband said "is that the proper way to address hotel guests? she again said in louder voice ask your tour guide. my husband answered you know we are professionals in our country, she answered i don't care who you are or where you came from. after a while while my husband leaned on the front desk/reception she must have been feeling guilty because she suddenly shrieked out do you want my name/ do you want my name and suddenly stormed to the back room. People like this should be given this kind of job. with the rest of my tour group regrading the same woman, one asked where is this room located, where should we passed she just waved her arm to the left over there? but the elevator was on the right, to the other far end of the hotel foyer. when another guest asked where can i find the room (since there was no one to help us with our luggage at all) this woman again answered, did you not hear what i told one of your companions. i have never seen rudeness from the front desk, and a hotel carrying the Sheraton name. their career ad says (i copy pasted this from their site) Our service culture.It’s not just what we do, it’s how we do it. Guests notice our super-comfy beds and our free bottled water (by the way no free bottled water in the room), but they remember their experiences with the people who work at Four Points. They remember a genuine smile. And a caring attitude. The dining room associate who remembered just how they took their coffee.We get it done right. In an honest and caring way. " i didn't see this at all with this person. The saving grace of this hotel is the kind man at the souvenir shop very helpful, and we had to pay for the advertised free shuttle, but the driver was very helpful. the dining experience was not memorable, slabs of meet were practically thrown down on our plates. this hotel needs to train their staff again.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle is no longer free”
Reviews.Author: MichaelTX
Reviews.Content: When we selected this hotel, one of the main reasons we booked it was the free shuttle. The hotel was about a third of the price (redeeming Starpoints) of a more convenient location, and we were willing to spend an hour or two a day on the shuttle to save that. When we checked in on 1/31/2010, we were informed that the shuttle would no longer be free starting the next day (2/1/2010). It would be 5 Euros per person per trip, or 8 Euros per person per roundtrip. With four of us, that would have been 32 Euros per day. I said that was unacceptable. It was promoted as free when we booked the hotel and we had never been notified of any changes. I demanded to talk with the manager and was told that he would be in the next morning. I insisted that she call him immediately and that I would not stay there if they charged us for the shuttle. A few minutes later, he came out to talk to me. (HUH? He was there and they tried to pretend he wasn't?!?!?!) He said they would not charge us for the shuttle. When we got to the room, we couldn't get the lights to work. We finally figured out that the electronic keycard has to be put in the slot by the door. The rooms were very poorly soundproofed. We could hear road noise all night and noise from the room above us. The beds were the most uncomfortable I've ever slept on in a major chain. There was a fridge in the room, which was nice. The shuttle was fairly convenient and reliable for us. We made reservations the day before. One day it was full (and a couple people without reservations were turned away), but most of the time we were the only ones on it. The shuttle reeked of cigarette smoke, but what doesn't in Europe. One day, it left the Rome pickup 12 minutes early - fortunately, we were early. On another day, it was 20 minutes late. We found a good grocery store and a great restaurant, each within walking distance (about a kilometer away). Since we used Starpoints, breakfast wasn't included. The normal price for the buffet is 25 Euros per person. We spent less than 25 Euros at the grocery store and had drinks, croissants, snacks, fruit, yougurt, cheese, meat, and more to last all four of us all four days. I highly recommend the restaurant that the hotel suggested (La Bomboniera). They're open for dinner after 7pm Tuesday through Sunday, and their pastas and pizzas were great. It was a little difficult to find the first time, but was worth it. Overall, it was a fair value but far more inconvenient than I had expected. Next time we return to Rome, we'll stay somewhere more convenient and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Out of the Way, but a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JunkPileQueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in summer 08 with my late father. I had been on leave from a contract job in Kandahar at the time. This hotel was in the Roman 'burbs, but it was still very nice. Dad and I made use of the shuttle bus and found it easy to use, with a reasonable schedule. The ride into the city was nice, and we were dropped at the edge of the Ancient City, so it was a bit of a walk to reach most sites. We didn't mind too much though. The drive to and from was a bit long, but lots of neat stuff too see out the window and lots of time to rest up on the drive in. The hotel itself was very nice. The breakfast was AMAZING, and we ate well every day. The restaurant and bar menus were nice and the food and booze was good. The room was quite nice, and we had more than enough room. The Internet was not free, but that was ok, because neither of us really needed to use it. The neighbour hood around the hotel was quiet and fairly walkable. There were a lot of great little places around if you're hungry, and there was even a small market that sold fruits and veggies. A bank was also nearby, helpful when you need to grab some cash before heading into the City. The hotel staff were all very nice and helpful to us. We were especially happy to meet one of the bartenders, a friendly fellow by the name of Fabrizio. The pool was nice and bright, but the jacuzzi was closed. All in all, this is really nice place to stay. You do not always have to stay in the centre of the action to enjoy your stay. What was really nice, in addition to the shuttle, was that the gift shop sold transit tickets, so you're all set. Try the 'burbs sometime, you might be surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: loscore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was friendly and helpful and willing to do their best to answer any questions we had. The breakfast was very good and had a nice variety. Our room was not large but was adequate by European standards. Everything was in good repair and very clean. The free shuttle service provided by the hotel was very convenient and easy to use and we took advantage of it every day of our stay. Overall this was a great experience and I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here and don't order a taxi from them”
Reviews.Author: AirworldAlan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way out of the way. The rooms are clean but sterile. We ate in the restaurant and my food came late and was cold. Above all, do not allow them to call you a taxi. They only use 2 companies and the companies charge between 10 and 15 euros just to show up. They also insisted on using a higher rate for taking me to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: DangA3
Reviews.Content: small beds. small bathrooms, limited facilties, no plces of interest within the vicinity. not very helpful if you need local currency.

Reviews.Title: “Far away!”
Reviews.Author: teacherw0man
Reviews.Content: I had to risk life and limb to reach this hotel. While we had been told that the shuttle was easy to reach, it ended up being a confusing mess as there were several hotels picking up at this very inconvenient location. After attempting to board two buses with big Sheraton signs on the side and discovering they were not going to our hotel we were finally directed to a small van parked in the median. After dashing across several lanes of traffic Frogger-style, we finally found the shuttle and settled in for the long ride out to the hotel. Once we got there, the hotel itself was nice enough -- clean and with a nice bathroom. The staff was friendly and ordered pizza for us from a place the staff frequents. My husband had to walk to pick it up, but it was a great deal in comparison to prices in the hotel restaurant. Overall, it was worth staying there on our way out of town because it was free with points. I would not recommend it to sight-seers.

Reviews.Title: “quite far out but very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: willw
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights during the world swimming championships. although my roman native friends told me it would be hopeless for getting in and out, in fact the combination of the hotels free shuttle bus (reservations usually required) and the brilliant public transport in the area (705 bus and then the metro, or the 130 bus all the way to city centre) meant it wasn't too bad at all. the one night i got stuck at the nearest metro station (EUR Fermi on line B) and couldn't find a bus back to the hotel, the reception kindly asked the shuttle bus driver who was passing to rescue me. room was perfectly clean but the air conditioning system was a little noisy to still be able to sleep, but then when i turned it off the room temperature quickly rose to 25 degrees C. you pick and choose ! breakfast was adequate but uninspiring. i liked being able to grab quick meals in the bar in the late evenings and there were some lively crowds of japanese and american guests in the lobby. so if you collect starwood points and want a good base for exploring rome i would recommend this hotel, but if you want to be bang in the middle of the action or need frequent access to your room during the day you will probably want to look elsewhere. it worked for me.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: tiisai
Reviews.Content: Bad Service all the way through. We were travelling as a group and the check in is already horriable. The lady asked us to come to the right, then she went to do other things to the left, then she call us to the left. what the hack?? The rooms are decent they are clean but that is it. A crapy new smart card system that is so smart it makes the lights go off every few minutes in the room. When requested to have a change of room, it was an advanture. Front desk won't believe us and keep sending people up. It took almost an hour before they are willing to give us a change of room and this is midnight we are talking about. The hotel is quite far from city center so don't stay if you are planning to go into the action. And to top everything off. Taxi request. Better arrange it yourself because the front desk is useless. Requested a cab for 7 am. No cab show up till 7:40 am (we stand infront of the the front desk and said you call a cab right now!!). Requested another cab for a few in the group to go to the airport at 7:15 am. No cab show up till almost 8 am and is a cab so small that it hardly fit 4 adult let alone suitcase, good thing there was another cab that drop off other passengers. May want to skip breakfast too cause not much to talk about.

Reviews.Title: “Great, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BoffinChemist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel because I was not visiting Rome, just transiting between the airport and a cruise that left the next day. My luggage failed to arrive at Rome airport and the hotel staff were fantastic at contacting lost luggage, getting them to track the cruise so my luggage could be returned at some other port (it turned up 3 days later in Monaco). They also arranged a taxi to take me to the cruise the next day via Parco Leonardo, so I could pick up some clothes, toiletries etc. The hotel was very comfortable and great value for money. Meals were good an not expensive but internet access was very bad. I would stay at this hotel next time I'm in Rome primarily due to the great staff and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disaster.”
Reviews.Author: RayL
Reviews.Content: We stayedi n this hotel on the way back from the Amalfi Coast to catch a plane to KL. Out of all the hotels we stayed in Europe and KL this is the only one I have written a bad review about. The hotel claims it is a 15 minute trip from the airport (must be by helicopter). The cab cost 55 euros and 50 euros for the return fare. The room on the second floor (despite being a gold SPG member) was the noisiest room we have ever stayed in. It rained during the night . There is a void next to the room and perhaps the rain noise was coming from there. Impossible to sleep and would have insisted on a change at 2am except for the wife. I complained next day to the receptionist and followed up with an email but no reponse. Had dinner in the restaurant and the meal was fine but service was hopeless. A very distinct pecking order amongst the staff which was very very poor. They advertise a shuttle but you really need to read the timetable as it is hopeless. To close an absolute disaster of a hotel and the management needs to be changed. n

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Kentish
Reviews.Content: Think it is fine for what it is - a large conference/chain hotel on the outskirts of Rome. Don't expect luxury and you won't be disappointed. We had no problems with the shuttle - which is a large coach, not a minibus (as we had expected). Clearly a popular hotel with large groups of US tourists, who can take over the public areas, audibly and physically. Our room was fine - we were put into a junior suite which was clean, spacious and modern. If time is short though, there probably are better options closer to Rome to save time on the coach, but a good safe choice for a weekend break. We wandered out to eat - right at the end of the row of shops (it's almost banana shaped, so imagine the opposite end to the hotel) we found a fantastic little Italian Trattoria. Cheap, honest homecooked food that was some of the best we ate all weekend irrespective of price. We were the only non-Italians in there and judging by the steady stream of takeaway pizzas and lasagnes being taken home, we were not alone in appreciating it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandJohn
Reviews.Content: A very clean hotel with very heplful staff. Well priced if you can incorporate a weekend deal. The restaurant was fantastic and so were all of the staff. The free shuttle bus never let us down. (15 mins late one day but the traffic was very bad - elections were on and the Pope was throwing a party in the square...) Couldn't master the air conditioning system but not an expert as I live in Scotland. (What is air conditioning anyway?) Nor could we get a movie on screen. The hotel was a 30 - 40 min ride from the city which went in quite quickly, but the cleanliness and restaurant makes it worthwhile. Exec suite and Junior suites were excellent. No problems in recommending this one to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As others have stated, the Four Points Sheraton is not in the heart of Rome. There is a shuttle that leaves the hotel every 1 1/2 hours so if you do miss the shuttle you do have a problem. We would take the shuttle every morning at either 8:00am or 9:30am and return on the 11:30pm shuttle. The ride takes about 30 to 45 minutes depending on traffic. If you're looking to save some money and don't mind being outside Rome, I'd recommend this hotel. The staff is very helpful in terms of providing information, making restaurant reservations, etc. Also the rooms are very large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Trust the Shuttle! Stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: WillCulp
Reviews.Content: Do not rely on the "complimentary shuttle service" advertised by this hotel. We chose this hotel our last night for the sole purpose of easily being able to use the shuttle to get to the train station and then Fiumicino airport. Hoped to avoid the steep cab fares and having to drag bags through Rome. HOWEVER, the shuttle never showed up the next morning. The hotel offered no assistance and showed me a printout of the shuttle times with a disclaimer that says, "The hotel denies any responsibility for delays due to traffic jam, lack of seats, and/or breakage of the vehicle." This is not on the website. They did try to call the driver, but got no reponse. That was the extent of their "help". Ironic that even though the shuttle has the hotel name on the side, they deny responsibility. HMMMMMMM... I ended up paying $60 for a cab to the airport and lost the money I had spent on the train tickets. 10 or so other people were also planning on going into Rome for the day and were quite irate themselves. I had stayed in Rome the other nighs of my trip and had no issues. If you're looking for a neat experience, may I suggest renting an apartment. We rented two separate apartments through htt---------- and had a wonderful experience. Excellent locations and VERY helpful, VERY friendly landlords/managers. Convenient locations within walking distance of all the sites of Rome. Stay away from the Sheraton! I was seething the entire flight back to the US!

Reviews.Title: “Okay-don't expect something great”
Reviews.Author: dr_zito
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in Feb 2005 with my Starwood Points. PROS: - You know what to expect. The lowest quality Sheraton but OK for one night. The price for 1 night was EUR 115 w/buffet breakfast. The staff is friendly and willing to help. The issue about the magnetic key for the door is sometimes usual in many hotels. The thing about the swimming cap doesn´t make your stay better or worse and you look really funny with it! Take a pic! CON: A very important CON is the location. It is very far from the center of Rome. If you do not get the shuttle or miss it, you will have to take the metro from Rome to a bus station and then a bus to the hotel. At least 80-90 minutes. Same thing when you go the other way. The shuttle service is not the best since it sometimes leaves the designated places BEFORE the scheduled time. So you get there on time and it´s gone. One thing you can do is phone the hotel and tell them to ring the driver and let him know that you will be there. It works. TIP FOR ROME AIRPORT: When you arrive, even late at night, do not choose to take the "non-official" taxis offered to you at loud voice. They charge sometimes twice the regular taxis. Get in line with the locals waiting for cabs and eventually yours will come. I got in at 1AM and waited 15 minutes but paid 30 euro instead of 50 to the Hotel. During working hours taxis are there in millions

Reviews.Title: “Four Points Roma Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Donnel
Reviews.Content: We were to leave on a cruise from the port for Rome and fortunately came upon the Four Points by Sheraton. It was convenient to the airport, yet far enough away to avoid the noise, convenient to Rome and to the Port. Shuttle buses provided convenient transportation to all three locations. The accommodations were good, the price was right (90 euros-6/10/04-including breakfast), and we enjoyed our stay. Next time we leave on a cruise from the area, we will not hesitate making reservations at this convenient hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Roma West
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Eroi di Cefalonia 301, 00128 Rome, Italy (Formerly Nicolaus Hotels Roma West)
